thread.title: Trump Pentagon chief tells Nato allies to up spending
thread.title_full: Trump Pentagon chief tells Nato allies to up spending

title: Trump Pentagon chief tells Nato allies to up spending
text: show ad Pentagon chief's unprecedented ultimatum to Nato: Increase your defense spending or U.S. will 'moderate its commitment' to alliance Jim Mattis, Trump's Pentagon secretary, made first trip to Nato summit in Munich where he gave ultimatum to members to spend more on defense 'No longer can the American taxpayer carry a disproportionate share of the defense of Western values,' Mattis told the alliance's 27 other defense ministers 'Americans cannot care more for your children's future security than you do,' he added Some of Nato's members are spending less than mandatory 2 per cent of GDP on defense, including economic powerhouse Germany UK is backing Mattis with Defence Secretary Sir Michael Fallon saying he is producing road map to get spending on track for other member states U.S. forces, tanks and aircraft are being deployed on the eastern borders of Nato under Operation Atlantic Resolve in show of force aimed at Russia Published: 15:48 GMT, 15 February 2017 | Updated: 20:20 GMT, 15 February 2017 77 shares
